Ziegler, Suzanne G.

“The Family Unit and International Migration: The Perceptions of Italian Immigrant Children.” International Migration Review, vol. 11 no. 3 (1977) pp. 326-333.

Ziegler, Suzanne G.

The Adaptation of Italian Immigrants to Toronto, Ontario: An Analysis. PhD thesis, University of Colorado, 1971. viii, 162 p.

Ziegler, Suzanne & A. H. Richmond

“School for Life: The Experience of Italian Immigrants in Canadian Schools,” Human Organization vol. 39 no. 3 (1980): 263-67.

Ziegler, Suzanne & A. H. Richmond

Characteristics of Italian Householders in Metropolitan Toronto. Toronto, ON: York University, 1972. (Ethnic Research Programme Report E6).

Zolfo, Vincenzo

Grazie Padre. Confessioni d’un barbiere. Montreal, PQ: Montfort et Villeroy, 1998.

Zorzi Pugliese, Olga, Guido Pugliese & Angelo Principe

“Uncompromising Gaze: The Art of Albert Chiarandini O.S.A., F.I.I.A.L.” Italians in Canada: Selected Studies in Art, Literrature, and History, special issue Quaderni d’Italianistica, vol. 33 no. 1 (2012): 9-36.

Zorzi Pugliese, Olga

“Beautifying the City: 1960s Artistic Mosaics by Italian Canadians in Toronto,” Italians in Canada: Selected Proceedings from the Annual Meeting of the Canadian Society for Italian Studies, special issue of Quaderni d’Italianistica ed. Gabriele Scardellato, vol. 28, no. 1, (2007): 93-114.

Zorzi Pugliese, Olga

“The Mosaic Ceiling of 1933 at the Royal Ontario Museum and Its Craftsmen: The Untold Story.” Decorative Arts, vol. 11 no. 2 (2004): 59-77.

Zorzi Pugliese, Olga and Angelo Principe

Rekindling Faded Memories: The History of the `Famee Furlane’ of Toronto, 1932-1942. Toronto, ON: Famee Furlane, 1996.

Zucchero, Jim

“Internment and Duliani’s The City Without Women: A Case Study for Multiculturalism in Canada.” In: Licia Canton et al. eds., Beyond Barbed Wire: Essays on the Internment of Italian Canadians, Toronto, ON: Guernica Editions, 2012, pp. 295-336.

Zucchero, Jim

“Introduction: Confronting the Legacy of Shame.” In: Licia Canton et al. eds., Beyond Barbed Wire: Essays on the Internment of Italian Canadians, Toronto, ON: Guernica Editions, 2012, pp. 5-14.

Zucchi, Flavia

“A First Experiment in Friulian Heritage Language Teaching.” Polyphony: The Bulletin of the Multicultural History Society of Ontario, vol. 11 no. 1-2 (1989): 154-156.

Zucchi, John E.

“The Italian Immigrant Presence in Canada, 1840-1990.” In: The Columbus People: Perspectives in Italian Immigration to the Americas and Australia, eds. Lydio F. Tomasi, Piero Gastaldo, and Thomas Row, New York, N.Y.: Center for Migration Studies, 1994, pp. 368-380.

Zucchi, John E.

“Historical Studies on Italian Immigrants to Canada.” Annali Accademici Canadesi, Biblioteca, vol. 2 (1991) pp. 39-48.

Zucchi, John E.

“Neighbourhood and Paesani.” In: The Italian Immigrant Experience, eds. A. Pucci and G. Potestio. Thunder Bay, ON: Canadian Italian Historical Association, 1988, pp. 29-40.

Zucchi, John E.

Italians in Toronto: Development of a National Identity, 1875-1935. Kingston and Montreal: McGill-Queen’s University Press, 1988. 255 p.

Zucchi, John E.

“Occupazioni, iniziative commerciali e catena migratoria: i commercianti di frutta da Imerese a Toronto, 1900-1930.” Nuovi Quaderni del Meridione, vol. 24, no. 95-96 (1986) pp. 233-245.

Zucchi, John E.

“Precursors of the `New Immigration’: Italian Street Musicians, 1815-1885.” Paper presented in the Elia Chair Seminar Series in Italian-Canadian Studies, York University, North York, ON, 13 February 1986. 20 leaves.

Zucchi, John E.

“Italian Hometown Settlements and the Development of an Italian Community in Toronto, 1875-1935.” In: Gathering Place: Peoples and Neighbourhoods of Toronto, 1834-1945, ed. Robert F. Harney. Toronto, ON: Multicultural History Society of Ontario, 1985, pp. 121-146.

Zucchi, John E.

“Italian Hometown Settlements and the Development of an Italian Community in Toronto, 1875-1935.” Polyphony: The Bulletin of the Multicultural History Society of Ontario, vol. 7 no. 2 (1985): 20-27.

Zucchi, John E.

“Mining, Railway Building and Street Construction: Italians in Ontario Before WW I.” Polyphony: The Bulletin of the Multicultural History Society of Ontario, vol. 7 no. 2 (1985): 7-13.

Zucchi, John E.

“Occupations, Enterprise, and Migration Chain: The Fruit Traders from Termini Imerese in Toronto, 1900-1930.” Studi Emigrazione/Études migrations, vol. 22 no. 77 (1985) pp. 68-80.

Zucchi, John E.

“Church, Clergy, and the Religious Life of Toronto’s Italian Immigrants, 1900-1940.” In: Proceedings of the Fiftieth Anniversary Conference of the Canadian Catholic Historical Association. Ottawa, ON, 1984, pp. 533-548.

Zucchi, John E.

“Paesani or Italiani? Local and National Loyalties in an Italian Immigrant Community.” In: The Family and Community Life of Italian North Americans, ed. Richard N. Juliani. Staten Island, N.Y.: American-Italian Historical Association, 1983, pp. 147-160.
